topTen.title: Avatar: Fire and Ash
topTen.description: Jake and Neytiri's with grief after Neteyam's death, encountering a new, aggressive Na'vi tribe, the Ash People, who are led by the fiery Varang, as the conflict on Pandora escalates and a new moral focus emerges.

topTen.title: Wake Up Dead Man
topTen.description: Jake and Neytiri's with grief after Neteyam's death, encountering a new, aggressive Na'vi tribe, the Ash People, who are led by the fiery Varang, as the conflict on Pandora escalates and a new moral focus emerges.

topTen.title: Stranger Things
topTen.description: Benoit Blanc returns for his most dangerous case yet.

topTen.title: Pluribus
topTen.description: In 1980s Indiana, a group of young friends witness supernatural forces and secret government exploits. As they search for answers, the children unravel a series of extraordinary mysteries.

topTen.title: IT: Welcome to Derry
topTen.description: In 1962, a couple with their son move to Derry, Maine just as a young boy disappears. With their arrival, very bad things begin to happen in the town.

topTen.title: Dhurandhar
topTen.description: A mysterious traveler slips into the heart of Karachi's underbelly and rises through its ranks with lethal precision, only to tear the notorious ISI-Underworld nexus apart from within.

topTen.title: The Abandons
topTen.description: When a corrupt force of wealth and power covets the lands of a group of diverse and atypical families and tries to drive them out, they must pursue their Manifest Destiny.

topTen.title: Supergirl
topTen.description: It follows Kara Zor-El's story and her darker origin before she finally made her way to Earth.

myShow.title: Avatar: Fire and Ash
myShow.description: Jake and Neytiri's with grief after Neteyam's death, encountering a new, aggressive Na'vi tribe, the Ash People, who are led by the fiery Varang, as the conflict on Pandora escalates and a new moral focus emerges.

comments.comment: If you've seen the first two installments, the third is unlikely to surprise you. What we get once again is flawless, mesmerizing visuals stretched across nearly three hours of screen time, accompanied by familiar characters, predictable dramaturgy, and a storyline reduced to almost primitive straightforwardness.

The third chapter of Avatar is stunning, just like the previous ones. Visually it's on another level, with some of the best CGI and world-building you'll see in a cinema. The soundtrack does a lot of heavy lifting too, in my opinion. So the cast does.

interview.title: Why James Cameron Is the 'Actor Whisperer'
interview.description: Avatar: Fire and Ash stars Sigourney Weaver, Jack Champion, Bailey Bass, and Trinity Jo-Li Bliss reveal what it's like to work with director James Cameron.

myShow.storyLine: Jake and Neytiri's family grapples with grief, encountering a new, aggressive Na'vi tribe, the Ash People, who are led by the fiery Varang, as the conflict on Pandora escalates and a new moral focus emerges.

motion.title: Motion Picture Rating (MPA)
motion.desc: Rated PG-13 for intense sequences of violence and action, bloody images, some strong language, thematic elements and suggestive material

myShow.title: Wake Up Dead Man
myShow.description: Detective Benoit Blanc teams up with an earnest young priest to investigate a perfectly impossible crime at a small-town church with a dark history.

comments.comment: Before diving into the murder mystery aspect, I want to take a moment and acknowledge the commentary done on faith here.

This is the third Knives Out film and whilst perhaps it doesn't hit the mad heights of ingenuity of Glass Onion, it's still highly watchable and way better than the recent Hercule Poirot films of Kenneth Branagh. Josh O'Connor is surprisingly good as the trouy.

myShow.storyLine: Father Jud arrives in a quaint small town hoping to serve God, but finds only suspicion when the community's pillar is suddenly murdered. Branded an outsider and the prime suspect, the young priest is forced to join forces with Detective Blanc to expose the real killer.

motion.title: Motion Picture Rating (MPA)
motion.desc: Rated PG-13 for violent content, bloody images, strong language, some crude sexual material, and smoking.

myShow.title: Stranger Things
myShow.description: In 1980s Indiana, a group of young friends witness supernatural forces and secret government exploits. As they search for answers, the children unravel a series of extraordinary mysteries.

comments.comment: If you've seen the first two installments, the third is unlikely to surprise you. What we get once again is flawless, mesmerizing visuals stretched across nearly three hours of screen time, accompanied by familiar characters, predictable dramaturgy, and a storyline reduced to almost primitive straightforwardness.

The third chapter of Avatar is stunning, just like the previous ones. Visually it's on another level, with some of the best CGI and world-building you'll see in a cinema. The soundtrack does a lot of heavy lifting too, in my opinion. So the cast does.

interview.title: We Have Questions for the 'Stranger Things' Cast
interview.description: Millie Bobby Brown, Noah Schnapp, Natalia Dyer, Joe Keery, Charlie Heaton, Maya Hawke, and Jamie Campbell Bower tackle fan questions.

myShow.storyLine: In a small town where everyone knows everyone, a peculiar incident starts a chain of events that leads to a child's disappearance, which begins to tear at the fabric of an otherwise-peaceful community. Dark government agencies and seemingly malevolent supernatural forces converge on the town, while a few of the locals begin to understand that more is going on than meets the eye.

motion.title: Motion Picture Rating (MPA)
motion.desc: Rated PG-13 for intense sequences of violence and action, bloody images, some strong language, thematic elements and suggestive material

news.title: ‘Zootopia 2’ Becomes Disney’s Highest-Grossing Animated Film Ever With $1.46 Billion, Beating ‘Frozen 2’
news.body: The film hit the coveted $1 billion milestone after just 17 days of release, and it was the fastest PG-rated movie in history to do so. It’s been a particularly huge success in China, where many Hollywood movies have floundered in recent years. At just the Chinese box office, “Zootopia 2” has already zoomed past $500 million, the highest total for a U.S. movie by far. The only other film coming close is Disney
